name: peanut
description: PeaNUT is a self-hosted network visualization tool that provides insights into connected devices and services within homelab environments. It offers graph views for network topology and metadata.

features.title: Network Visualization
features.description: Interactive graph displays network topology showing connections between devices and services

features.title: Device Discovery
features.description: Automatically detect and map connected devices, servers, and services across your network

features.title: Service Monitoring
features.description: Track running services and their relationships to understand dependencies and system architecture

features.title: Metadata Display
features.description: View detailed information about each device including IP addresses, hostnames, and service details

features.title: Topology Mapping
features.description: Visual representation of network structure helps identify bottlenecks and plan infrastructure changes

features.title: Self-Hosted
features.description: Designed specifically for home server environments with features tailored to self-hosted setups

features.title: Offline Mode
features.description: Network graph updates automatically as devices come online or offline for current visibility

features.title: Custom Grouping
features.description: Organize devices into logical groups or categories for better organization of complex networks
